title: Exponential Decay - Wind Turbines - Part B

content.description:
A wind turbine uses the power of wind to generate electricity. The blades of the turbine make a noise that can be heard at a distance from the turbine. At a distance of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadsgacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@38F1@</annotation> </semantics> </math> meters from the turbine, the noise level is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>105</mn> </math> decibels. At a distance of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>100</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadsgacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@38F1@</annotation> </semantics> </math> meters from the turbine, the noise level is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>49</mn> </math> decibels.

The noise level can be modeled by the function <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>S</mn> </math> given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>S</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>d</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mi>a</mi> <msup> <mi>b</mi> <mi>d</mi> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D4C@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>S</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>d</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadofacaGGOaGaamizaiaacMcaaaa@3963@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is the noise level, in decibels, at a distance of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mn>d</mn> </math> meters from the turbine.
content.question:
Part B

(i) Use the given data to find the average rate of change of the noise level, in decibels per meter, from <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadsgacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@38F1@</annotation> </semantics> </math> to <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>100</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadsgacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@38F1@</annotation> </semantics> </math> meters. Express your answer as a decimal approximation. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(ii) Interpret the meaning of your answer from (i) in the context of the problem.

(iii) Use the average rate of change found in (i) to estimate the noise level, in decibels, at a distance of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>120</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadsgacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@38F1@</annotation> </semantics> </math> meters. Show the work that leads to your answer.

frqParts.text:
Part B

(i) Use the given data to find the average rate of change of the noise level, in decibels per meter, from <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadsgacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@38F1@</annotation> </semantics> </math> to <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>100</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadsgacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@38F1@</annotation> </semantics> </math> meters. Express your answer as a decimal approximation. Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(ii) Interpret the meaning of your answer from (i) in the context of the problem.

(iii) Use the average rate of change found in (i) to estimate the noise level, in decibels, at a distance of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>120</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadsgacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@38F1@</annotation> </semantics> </math> meters. Show the work that leads to your answer.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
